summary.para: Contains video format information that applies to both compressed and uncompressed formats.
This structure is used in the structure.

member.name: MFVideoInfo.dwWidth
member.summary: Width of the decoded image, in pixels.

member.name: MFVideoInfo.dwHeight
member.summary: Height of the decoded image, in pixels.

member.name: MFVideoInfo.PixelAspectRatio
member.summary: Pixel aspect ratio, specified as an structure.

member.name: MFVideoInfo.SourceChromaSubsampling
member.summary: Chroma sub-sampling of the original image, specified as a member of the enumeration.

member.name: MFVideoInfo.InterlaceMode
member.summary: Image interlacing, specified as a member of the enumeration.

member.name: MFVideoInfo.TransferFunction
member.summary: R'G'B' gamma curve function, specified as a member of the enumeration.

member.name: MFVideoInfo.ColorPrimaries
member.summary: Color primaries of the video source, specified as a member of the enumeration. This value provides the conversion from R'G'B' to linear RGB.

member.name: MFVideoInfo.TransferMatrix
member.summary: Conversion matrix from Y'Cb'Cr' to R'G'B, specified as a member of the enumeration.

member.name: MFVideoInfo.SourceLighting
member.summary: Intended viewing conditions, specified as a member of the enumeration.

member.name: MFVideoInfo.FramesPerSecond
member.summary: Frames per second, specified as an structure. If the frame rate is unknown or variable, the numerator and denominator should both be set to zero. It is invalid for only one member of the MFRatio structure to be zero.

member.name: MFVideoInfo.NominalRange
member.summary: Range of valid RGB values, specified as a member of the enumeration. The value indicates whether color values contain headroom and toeroom.

member.name: MFVideoInfo.GeometricAperture
member.summary: Geometric aperture, specified as an structure. For more information, see MF_MT_GEOMETRIC_APERTURE.

member.name: MFVideoInfo.MinimumDisplayAperture
member.summary: The display aperture, specified as an structure. The display aperture is the region of the video image that is intended to be shown. Any data outside of this area is the overscan region. For more information, see MF_MT_MINIMUM_DISPLAY_APERTURE.

member.name: MFVideoInfo.PanScanAperture
member.summary: Pan-scan rectangle, specified as an structure. The pan-scan rectangle defines a region of the image that is displayed in pan-and-scan mode. It can be used when wide-screen content is shown on a 4 x 3 display. The value is valid only when the VideoFlags member contains the MFVideoFlag_PanScanEnabled flag.

member.name: MFVideoInfo.VideoFlags
member.summary: Bitwise OR of zero or more flags from the enumeration.
